fields.description:
*SUMMARY*

Linked Perforce repos are not shown n the pulldown list of available repositories when used in 
a deployment environment.

*ENVIRONMENT*

* Bamboo 5.9.1, 5.9.7
* Perforce 

*REPRODUCTION*

# Create a linked repository to a Perforce depot
# Create a build plan, and include a "Source Code Checkout" task. You will see the repository in the list of available repos.
# Create a deployment project
# Add an "source Code download" to the environment, and select "Repository"

*EXPECTED RESULTS*

The Perforce linked repository should be presented to the user as a choice

*ACTUAL RESULTS*

No Perforce repository is shown. 

*NOTES*

*WORKAROUNDS*

# Define the required files as an artifact in an earlier stage, and pull down the artifact rather than calling the depot
# Creating a script taks to run a p4 sync in the required location may be a suitable work around.
fields.summary: Perforce linked repository not available in Deployment projects

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to the {{Plan Configuration >> Plan details}} page.
 # Uncheck the {{Plan enabled}} option.

h4. Expected behavior

If the Plan has been disabled, all the options under *'Automatically manage branches'* should be turned off automatically. As a result, Bamboo will stop trying to poll the primary source repository looking for changes.
h4. Problem

If any of the options inside {{Plan Configuration >> Branches}} under *'Automatically manage branches'* are enabled after disabling a Plan, Bamboo will keep trying to poll the repository.
h4. Workaround

Disable all the 3 options under *'Automatically manage branches'*.

!automatic-branch-management.png|thumbnail!
h4.
fields.summary: Disabled Plan keeps trying to poll repository

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user doesn't have permission to access _all_ deployment projects, Bamboo throws an error saying "Background page refresh cannot contact server. Please ensure Bamboo server is available." and none of the projects are visible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
* Create a deployment project.
* Restrict permission to that deployment project to one single user.
* Perform a deployment from that project
* Log in as a different user and go to Deploy > All Deployment Projects.

h3. Expected Results
The deployment projects that your user has access to are listed.

h3. Actual Results
No projects are listed and instead an error saying "Background page refresh cannot contact server. Please ensure Bamboo server is available" appears.

h3. Workarounds

There are no universal workarounds to this bug. Possibilities include:
 * Make all deployment projects visible to all users who need to see any deployment projects.  
 * Encourage users to view projects one at a time rather than through the dashboard.

h3. Notes
The following error is thrown in the Bamboo logs:

{code}
2015-11-03 17:28:06,557 WARN [ajp-nio-127.0.0.105-8009-exec-10] [AuthorizationLoggerListener] Authorization failed: org.acegisecurity.AccessDeniedException: Authentication username has NO permissions to the domain object com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.projects.DeploymentProjectImpl@1729d24; authenticated principal: org.acegisecurity.adapters.PrincipalAcegiUserToken@fa4521b: Username: username; Password: [PROTECTED]; Authenticated: true; Details: null; Granted Authorities: ROLE_USER, ROLE_RESTRICTEDADMIN; secure object: ReflectiveMethodInvocation: public abstract com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.projects.DeploymentProject com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.projects.service.DeploymentProjectService.getDeploymentProject(long); target is of class [com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.projects.service.DeploymentProjectServiceImpl]; configuration attributes: [ROLE_USER, ROLE_ANONYMOUS, AFTER_ACL_READ]
{code}
fields.summary: Deployment dashboard broken for users who cannot see all deployment projects

*Expected behavior*
Bamboo should mark the builds as failed when it failed to publish the artifact as the publishing task is part of build process.

fields.description:
h4. Duplication Steps
# Create the following build plans with the Repository Polling trigger type (60 second intervals):
** Plan A
** Plan B 
** Plan C
** Plan D 
** Plan E
# Configure parent/child relationship as follows:
||Parent||Child|
|Plan A|Plan B|
|Plan B|Plan C|
|Plan C|Plan D|
|Plan D|Plan E|
# Select the following options under Advanced options:
** Trigger dependencies only when all stages have been run successfully
** Enable dependencies for all branches of this plan
** Block build if parent plans have unbuilt changes
# Commit changes to Plan A, Plan D, and Plan E at once

You will notice Plan E does adhere to the blocking strategy but also triggers Plan D to build while Plan A is running and was triggered by Plan D to build initially. 

h4. Workaround
Remove triggers from child plan and create separate build plans for the repositories that need to be committed to individually.
fields.summary: "Block build if parent plans have unbuilt changes" still allows the triggering of child builds while parent is running

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a deployment requires a specific build/plan result to be successfully deployed and this deployment is covered by the _Minimum deployments to keep_ global expiry exception, its required build/plan result is not, which means, even if the build/plan result is required by the deployment to be successfully deployed it will be deleted by the global expiry.

h3. Suggested Solution
The required build/plan result should not be deleted by the global expiry as it is required by a deployment that is covered by the _Minimum deployments to keep_ global expiry exception so it should be kept.
Or these required build/plan results should be automatically labeled and their labels should be automatically added to the _Keep builds with the following labels_ global expiry exception.
 
h3. Workaround 
Label the required build/plan result and add this label to the _Keep builds with the following labels_ global expiry exception.

Or re-run the build/plan for it to generate its artifact again.
fields.summary: Build exception should also keep its required build/plan artifacts

fields.description:
When the same Issue Key is used for different branches ({{feature/MYPRJ-29-foo}} and {{feature/MYPRJ-29-bar}}), inconsistent results are shown.

In my example the "foo" branch was worked, and the ticket was closed. Later, the "bar" branch was opened. When using the rest call (before closing the "bar" ticket), it appears to use the "bar" information for the {{result key}} and {{link href}} information, however it uses the "foo" information for the {{result state}} field. This makes the data unusable for me.

I used the following REST call to obtain the status of all Bamboo builds for a particular feature branch:

{{http://bamboo.mycompany.com/rest/api/latest/result/PRJ?issueKey=MYPRJ-29}}
fields.summary: REST API reports issueKey status incorrectly for re-used issueKeys

fields.description:
I have a few project on Bitbucket and when I create new I want to setup the build. Now to do it:
# Copy existing (do not forget to disable!)
# Select another repository 
# Check trigger (remote) and IP Why?! I already have marked bitbucket checkbox. Ok, but move IT to admin section.
# Go to Bitbucket
# locate the project
# open setting
# find services (ignore deprecation warning)
# select new bamboo
# go back to the project to copy bamboo server URL
# past it on bitbucket server
# go back to the project to copy project plan key
# past it on bitbucket server
# type the bamboo user (I remember it)
# find the bamboo user password somewere
# paste it
# go to bamboo and enable project
# build it first time manually (I don't know why)
# pray that all steps above is correct, because no information in UI (bamboo and bitbucket) 

How I should be (IMHO)
I configure bitbucket account on Bamboo server once
# Copy existing (do not forget to disable!)
# Select another repository from bitbucket
# Enable builds
# See notifications:
* on bamboo if it can't setup communication with  bitbucket. 
* on bitbucket if it can't trigger.
fields.summary: Make the setup new project from Bitbucket easy

fields.description:
We have repository polling setup on 5 minute intervals for our git repos (commit hooks won't work with our setup), however if the internet has a hiccup, or BitBucket has a small outage, Bamboo disables every branch on every plan permanently with a "Can't detect changes" error

Having to go re-enable the branches by hand a couple times a week gets old pretty quickly. Writing a script for cron to run every 5 minutes to re-enable plan branches via the Bamboo API seems like something we shouldn't have to do.

Bamboo isn't setup to auto-manage the branches, no auto-merging, no cleanup after X days. So I can't really find any options to work around this behavior
fields.summary: Bamboo permanently disables plan branches if repository temporarily unavailable

fields.description:
We are running into situations where a build finishes, but the server doesn't think one of the jobs is really finished.  The job IS finished, the log shows that it's been completed and none of the processes are running on the bamboo agent host any more.  But, the server doesn't seem to think the job is finished.  This keeps the plan from ever running more builds (if it only runs one at a time) or a reduced number of builds (if it can run more than one at a time).  The job will never complete: we have builds in this state that are over 6 days old.

If you go to the website and click on the stuck job, then your browser will constantly reload the page every second, swapping from "finished" to "96% complete" etc. over and over.  You cannot click away from that browser tab or window: you have to close it.

There is no way that we've found to force the job to go complete or to stop it: selecting "Stop Build" does nothing, and you can't select "Stop Job" because the web page for the job is constantly reloading.

The only way we've found to clear the server of jobs hung in this state is to restart the server completely, which is really a problem since we usually are running builds 24/7.
fields.summary: Builds finish but the server  thinks they're still running, forever

fields.description:
When configuring an remote agent with -Xmx1024m, it may not modify the entry in wrapper.conf when it and other files are extracted.

Workaround: (1)
- extract the files via the install method then
- Manually update wrapper.conf

(2) The alternative is to add the Xmx parameter to the $COMMAND_LINE statements in bamboo-agent.sh, as the Tanuki wrapper can accept additional parameters to override what is in the wrapper.conf file.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Elastic agent does not start if base URL is using https

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run Bamboo using https
# Ensure that base URL is set to use the https URL
# Start elastic agent

h3. Expected Results
Agent should connect with no issues

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the elastic-agent.out file:
{noformat}
2015-10-21 13:11:49,741 FATAL [main] [AgentBootstrap] Exiting due to fatal exception.
org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.doExecute(AbstractHttpClient.java:867)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:82)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:106)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:57)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.bootstrap.AgentContext.initFingerprint(AgentContext.java:118)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.bootstrap.AgentContext.initServerSession(AgentContext.java:103)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.bootstrap.AgentContext.run(AgentContext.java:94)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.bootstrap.AgentBootstrap.run(AgentBootstrap.java:95)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.client.ElasticAgentBootstrap.run(ElasticAgentBootstrap.java:73)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.client.ElasticAgentBootstrap.main(ElasticAgentBootstrap.java:53)
Caused by: org.apache.http.HttpException: Unable to establish route: planned = {}->httpst://127.0.0.1:46593; current = {s}->httpst://127.0.0.1:46593
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.establishRoute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:818)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.tryConnect(DefaultRequestDirector.java:615)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.execute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:446)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.doExecute(AbstractHttpClient.java:863)
        ... 9 more
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.utils.IOUtils.closeQuietly(IOUtils.java:20)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.utils.IOUtils.printStream(IOUtils.java:46)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.installer.ElasticAgentInstaller.runCommand(ElasticAgentInstaller.java:103)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.installer.ElasticAgentInstaller.install(ElasticAgentInstaller.java:86)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.installer.ElasticAgentInstaller.main(ElasticAgentInstaller.java:155)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Start Bamboo with the following startup parameter:
{code}-Dbamboo.ec2.agent.endpoint=http://localhost:TOMCAT_PORT{code}
(i) Replace {{TOMCAT_PORT}} with the tomcat connector port
Take notice that using HTTP for agent to connect to Bamboo server instead of HTTPS is not compromising security because HTTP connection is only used to tunnel secure encrypted channels which are used for actual data transfer.
fields.summary: Elastic agent does not start if base URL is using https

fields.description:
*SUMMARY*
Branch clean up deletes new branch if the name is the same with previously deleted branch.

*SCENARIO*
* A branch created in repository e.g. "B1"
* Bamboo detected the branch and create a plan branch for it
* "B1" branch deleted from repository
* "B1" recreated in repository
* Bamboo deletes the branch after the set time met e.g. 7 days - even though "B1" recreated in repo
* Create plan branch in Bamboo manually and use "B1" as source repo
* Bamboo immediately delete the plan branch when branch clean up executed

Audit log sample:
{noformat}
03:00, 26 Sep 	SYSTEM 	Plan deleted: Test Plan - TEST - B1 (TEST-TEST3)
08:37, 25 Sep 	user1	New Plan branch created 		TEST-TEST3
03:00, 25 Sep 	SYSTEM 	Plan deleted: Test Plan - TEST - B1 (TEST-TEST2)
03:19, 24 Sep 	user1 	New Plan branch created 		TEST-TEST2
03:00, 24 Sep 	SYSTEM 	Plan deleted: Test Plan - TEST - B1 (TEST-TEST1)
01:21, 24 Sep 	user1 	New Plan branch created 		TEST-TEST1
{noformat}

*SUGGESTION*
Please use different branch name for now to avoid this behavior.
fields.summary: Branch clean up deletes new branch if the name is the same with previously deleted branch

    • java: -DDISABLE_AGENT_AUTO_CAPABILITY_DETECTION=true *
    *
*/ public static final SystemProperty DISABLE_AGENT_AUTO_CAPABILITY_DETECTION = new SystemProperty(false, "DISABLE_AGENT_AUTO_CAPABILITY_DETECTION"); {code} h3. 2. Steps to Reproduce # stop Bamboo (server) # add property to prevent agents from automatically overriding remote agent capabilities on new startup {code:title=/bin/setenv.sh, Windows (setenv.bat) - Linux/MacOSX (setenv.sh)} JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS="-DDISABLE_AGENT_AUTO_CAPABILITY_DETECTION=true" {code} # start Bamboo server # install Bamboo remote agent {code:java} java -Dbamboo.home=/path/to/remote-agent-home -jar atlassian-bamboo-agent-installer-5.9.x.jar http://BAMBOO_BASE_URL/agentServer/ {code} h3. 3. Expected Results According to Bamboo's documentation - [Disabling auto-capability detection for the remote agent|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/additional-remote-agent-options-436044733.html#Additionalremoteagentoptions-Disablingauto-capabilitydetectionfortheremoteagent] the remote agent should not automatically detect and add capabilities. {quote} There may be situations where you want to prevent Bamboo from automatically detecting and adding capabilities (such as JDKs) to the remote agent, or where you don't want to run the remote agent with default capabilities. {quote} h3. 4. Actual Results By going to "{{Bamboo administration >> Overview >> Build resources >> Agents}}" and selecting the "{{Remote Agent}}", under "{{Capabilities}}" tab we can find a few capabilities listed. The same can be reviewed by running the following SQL query against Bamboo's database: {code:sql} /* 1507331 is the remote agent id */ select * from queue as AGENT join capability as CAPABILITY on AGENT.capability_set = CAPABILITY.capability_set where AGENT.capability_set = 1507331; {code} As a response from the query above, you can find the following: ||queue_id||agent_type||title||agent_description||created_date||updated_date||enabled||capability_set||last_start_time||last_stop_time||elastic_instance_id||elastic_image||capability_id||key_identifier||value||capability_set|| |1474563|REMOTE|192.168.10.80|Remote agent on host 192.168.10.80|2015-10-20 12:19:49|2015-10-20 12:19:49|true|1507331|2015-10-20 12:19:49|(null)|(null)|(null)|1540115|system.builder.mvn3.Maven 3|/opt/maven/apache-maven-3.3.3|1507331| |1474563|REMOTE|192.168.10.80|Remote agent on host 192.168.10.80|2015-10-20 12:19:49|2015-10-20 12:19:49|true|1507331|2015-10-20 12:19:49|(null)|(null)|(null)|1540114|system.jdk.JDK|/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_79.jdk/Contents/Home|1507331| |1474563|REMOTE|192.168.10.80|Remote agent on host 192.168.10.80|2015-10-20 12:19:49|2015-10-20 12:19:49|true|1507331|2015-10-20 12:19:49|(null)|(null)|(null)|1540113|system.jdk.JDK 1.7|/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_79.jdk/Contents/Home|1507331| |1474563|REMOTE|192.168.10.80|Remote agent on host 192.168.10.80|2015-10-20 12:19:49|2015-10-20 12:19:49|true|1507331|2015-10-20 12:19:49|(null)|(null)|(null)|1540112|system.hg.executable|/usr/local/bin/hg|1507331| |1474563|REMOTE|192.168.10.80|Remote agent on host 192.168.10.80|2015-10-20 12:19:49|2015-10-20 12:19:49|true|1507331|2015-10-20 12:19:49|(null)|(null)|(null)|1540111|system.git.executable|/usr/local/bin/git|1507331| |1474563|REMOTE|192.168.10.80|Remote agent on host 192.168.10.80|2015-10-20 12:19:49|2015-10-20 12:19:49|true|1507331|2015-10-20 12:19:49|(null)|(null)|(null)|1540110|system.jdk.JDK 1.7.0_79|/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_79.jdk/Contents/Home|1507331| |1474563|REMOTE|192.168.10.80|Remote agent on host 192.168.10.80|2015-10-20 12:19:49|2015-10-20 12:19:49|true|1507331|2015-10-20 12:19:49|(null)|(null)|(null)|1540109|foo|bar|1507331 h3. 5. Notes In the above example, it was created "{{/bin/bamboo-capabilities.properties}}"with the following content: {code:title=/bin/bamboo-capabilities.properties} foo=bar {code} And we can notice the capability was added to the remote agent. ||queue_id||agent_type||title||agent_description||created_date||updated_date||enabled||capability_set||last_start_time||last_stop_time||elastic_instance_id||elastic_image||capability_id||key_identifier||value||capability_set|| |1474563|REMOTE|192.168.10.80|Remote agent on host 192.168.10.80|2015-10-20 12:19:49|2015-10-20 12:19:49|true|1507331|2015-10-20 12:19:49|(null)|(null)|(null)|1540109|foo|bar|1507331

fields.description:
During the creation of a plan, under "Link repository to new build plan", when "Bitbucket is selected, the only available input fields are:
* Display name
* Username
* Password

I have enabled 2FA on my account, and when I input these details, clicking "Load Repositories" causes a 401 Unauthorized error.

I know that I can link the repository using the 'git' link, but it's probably worth looking into allowing Bamboo to interface with 2FA Bitbucket accounts somehow.
fields.summary: Can't link Bitbucket Cloud repository with 2FA

It would be better if there is a function to delete audit logs older than a certain date.

fields.description:
Some customers needs to lock down the "Contact Administrators" hyperlink  shown on Bamboo pages footer.
Today It's possible to edit some files in <bamboo-install-directory> to achieve that, but the changes needs to be done again after Bamboo upgrades.
fields.summary: Configuration option to lock down "Contact Administrators" on the Bamboo pages footer.

fields.description:
Hi There,

We are using Atlassian bamboo for our builds. We need to setup a WAS task to start and stop websphere applications. Websphere is installed on another host. 

Can you please let us know how can we configure the websphere tasks as bamboo is recongnising only local instance of websphere.

Can we install remote agent on the remote host and configure websphere tasks on that?

Regards,

Ramya
fields.summary: Configuring WAS Tasks on remote hosts

fields.summary: Can't open branches tab on plan configuration page

fields.description:
The "Artifact definitions" page shows the defined artifacts in alphabetical order.
The pages that show the created Artifacts do so in the order they were defined.
It would be an improvement to show the created Artifacts in alphabetical order, case-insensitive.
fields.summary: Show created Artifacts in alphabetical sort order

fields.description: Enable support for Integrated Authentication for MSSQL database in Bamboo.
fields.summary: Support Windows/Intergrated Authentication for MSSQL database

fields.description:
Number of threads gets so high that there is left no memory for new threads. Bamboo agents then stop connecting and hence no jobs are run, but bamboo server itself continues to run. To release memory we have restarted bamboo server, and agents then connect fine again until this builds up again in about a weeks time.

Stacktrace has a lot of these:

sintefbamboo atlassian]# grep org.eclipse.jgit.util.io.StreamCopyThread.run ST | wc –l
3902

These are threads that hangs on this method.

According to http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/hotspotfaq-138619.html default stack per thread is 1M.

Stacktrace per thread looks like this:

"4-BAM::PlanExec:pool-8-thread-2-StreamCopy" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00007f6d5c7a1800 nid=0x4f51 in
Object.wait() [0x00007f6d80124000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (on object monitor)
        at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
        at java.io.PipedInputStream.read(PipedInputStream.java:327)
        - eliminated <0x00000007238e43c8> (a java.io.PipedInputStream)
        at java.io.PipedInputStream.read(PipedInputStream.java:378)
        - locked <0x00000007238e43c8> (a java.io.PipedInputStream)
        at java.io.InputStream.read(InputStream.java:101)
        at org.eclipse.jgit.util.io.StreamCopyThread.run(StreamCopyThread.java:125)


StreamCopyThread is called with input and output streamas; http://download.eclipse.org/jgit/docs/jgit-2.0.0.201206130900-r/apidocs/org/eclipse/jgit/util/io/StreamCopyThread.html

Class StreamCopyThread
Constructor Summary
StreamCopyThread(InputStream i, OutputStream o) 
          Create a thread to copy data from an input stream to an output stream	



PipedInputStream  has the following note in http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/PipedInputStream.html

Class PipedInputStream
•	java.lang.Object
•	
o	java.io.InputStream
o	
	java.io.PipedInputStream
•	All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
________________________________________

public class PipedInputStream
extends InputStream
A piped input stream should be connected to a piped output stream; the piped input stream then provides whatever data bytes are written to the piped output stream. Typically, data is read from a PipedInputStream object by one thread and data is written to the corresponding PipedOutputStream by some other thread. Attempting to use both objects from a single thread is not recommended, as it may deadlock the thread. The piped input stream contains a buffer, decoupling read operations from write operations, within limits. A pipe is said to be broken if a thread that was providing data bytes to the connected piped output stream is no longer alive.


This might be the reason this many threads don't quit nicely.

We recently upgraded to 5.9.4 to see if this helped, but the problem continues.

Please advice on both short term and long term solutions.
fields.summary: Bamboo JGit threads build up and uses all memory

fields.description:
Customers with many or complex environments would like to have the same permissions applied to all of the deployment environments of the same type. 

For example, all of the "Dev" deployments could have the same permissions set allowing only developers to deploy there, and all of the "Prod" plans could have permissions that would not allow developers to deploy to a given set of environments.

Rather than statically assigned groups, this would apply to the type of environment (prod/test/dev/etc)

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In the following example we will be using MySQL but the same applies to PostgreSQL, MSSQL and such.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# connect to MySQL database:
{code}
# USERNAME, i.e.: root
# PASSWORD, i.e.: toor
# HOSTNAME, i.e.: localhost
# DATABASE, i.e.: bamboo-5.9.4
mysql -u USERNAME -pPASSWORD --host=HOSTNAME_IP --port=3306 DATABASE
{code}

mysql > show tables;

fields.description:
Creating a new Git repository should be validating the username and password when it's being entered. 

Ideally the same validation error message that's being showed for Subversion should be available
-- e.g.  _This is not a valid Subversion repository: svn: E170001: Authentication required for '<https://svn.example.com:443> Subversion'_ 

This feature not being implemented has cause us a massive headache. As the password was entered wrong or with a hidden character. This effectively locked out the system id causing all subsequent builds on the instance to fail.
fields.summary: The Git repository host doesn't validate incorrect usernames and passwords

fields.description:
Transition from jTDS to Microsoft JDBC driver is mainly because of supportability. [Microsoft's JDBC driver|https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/sqlserver/aa937724.aspx] is actively maintained, where jTDS is only recently seeing its first updates in over 3 years.

Reference: [Transitioning from jTDS to Microsoft's JDBC driver for Stash|https://confluence.atlassian.com/stash/transitioning-from-jtds-to-microsoft-s-jdbc-driver-318669456.html#notfound]
fields.summary: Transitioning from jTDS to Microsoft JDBC Driver for Bamboo

The SSH package that comes with msysgit has a known performance issue. 

h4. Workaround
Use Git for Windows
https://git-scm.com/download/win

(i) We should add a note in the Bamboo supported platforms page to warn users about using msysgit or mark it as unsupported
fields.summary: Poor performance with msysgit

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a Stash linked repository in Bamboo
# Create a plan using the Stash repo
# Create a plan branch
# Delete key in Stash user profile
# Go to linked repository and resave the configuration to regenerate the keys
# Check the SSH keys used by the master branch and the branch via the database

h4. Expected Behaviour
The branch plan repositories should use the same keys as the master plan

h4. Observed Behaviour
The branch plan keys are still using the outdated keys
fields.summary: Branch Plan SSH keys for Stash linked repositories are not updated when the keys are regenerated

fields.description:
Please update the SSH exchange key algorithms that are used by the current Bamboo java library. Based on the current encryption levels, {{SSH}} and {{SCP}} tasks can fail with the following error message if your environment is set to use higher encrypted algorithms:

{noformat}
Starting task 'SCP <application> to <server name>' of type 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-scp-plugin:scptask'
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 Connecting to <server name>.<domain> on port: 22
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 Failed to connect to host
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 net.schmizz.sshj.transport.TransportException: Unable to reach a settlement: [diffie-hellman-group14-sha1, diffie-hellman-group1-sha1] and [curve25519-sha256@libssh.org, ecdh-sha2-nistp256, ecdh-sha2-nistp384, ecdh-sha2-nistp521, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1]
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Proposal.firstMatch(Proposal.java:145)
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Proposal.negotiate(Proposal.java:128)
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.KeyExchanger.gotKexInit(KeyExchanger.java:219)
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.KeyExchanger.handle(KeyExchanger.java:344)
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.TransportImpl.handle(TransportImpl.java:458)
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Decoder.decode(Decoder.java:107)
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Decoder.received(Decoder.java:175)
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Reader.run(Reader.java:61)
09-Oct-2015 14:15:42 Finished task 'SCP <application> to <server name>' with result: Error
{noformat}

We need to have a change made to the library to enable Bamboo to use higher encrypted algorithms. In the example above, the following algorithms are needed:

{noformat}
curve25519-sha256@libssh.org, ecdh-sha2-nistp256, ecdh-sha2-nistp384, ecdh-sha2-nistp521, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1
{noformat}
fields.summary: Update Bamboo SSH exchange key library to use higher encrypted algorithms

fields.description:
The steps to reproduce:

1] Created a new plan with two jobs (JOB01/JOB02), each having a single script task which printed some random numbers to output
2] Ran the plan 3 times - Made sure I could view logs of each job of each build
3] Removed JOB01
4] Tried to view build number 2

The outcome of this was that I got a 500...

The log for the request:

{noformat}
2013-07-15 03:18:10,168 INFO [qtp1234740309-377666] [AccessLogFilter] llovelock GET https://staging-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/chain/result/viewChainResult.action?planKey=PERSONAL-BUILD3713&buildNumber=2 2130407kb
2013-07-15 03:18:10,183 ERROR [qtp1234740309-377666] [FiveOhOh] 500 Exception was thrown.
com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to find Plan for PERSONAL-BUILD3713-JOB01-2
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.getInterruptibly(LazyReference.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.get(LazyReference.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.ResettableLazyReference.get(ResettableLazyReference.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.AbstractResultsSummary.getImmutablePlan(AbstractResultsSummary.java:152)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.beans.DecoratedNavObjectFactoryImpl.getDecoratedPlan(DecoratedNavObjectFactoryImpl.java:155)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.beans.DecoratedResult.<init>(DecoratedResult.java:75)
...
{noformat}

When I refreshed the page a couple of minutes later, the build showed without the JOB01, as expected.
fields.summary: Immediately after deleteing a job I recieve a 500 error when I visit a previous build which included that job

fields.description:
The documentation on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Using+global,+plan+or+build-specific+variables and https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Defining+plan+variables is a bit ambiguous/not straight forward in explaining the relationship between the plan variable name and the name with which it could be retrieved.

Maybe those 2 pages should be merged together and underneath the screen capture defining foo there should be the mention that we can get the content of that variable as bamboo.foo?
fields.summary: Improve bamboo documentation on plan variables

fields.description:
*Bamboo* had a resource that deserialised arbitrary user input without restriction. Attackers can use this vulnerability to execute Java code of their choice on systems that have a vulnerable version of *Bamboo*. To exploit this issue, attackers need to be able to access the *Bamboo* web interface. 


*Affected versions:*
* All versions of *Bamboo* from 2.2 before 5.8.5 (the fixed version for 5.8.x) and from 5.9.0 before 5.9.7 (the fixed version for 5.9.x) are affected by this vulnerability.


*Fix:*
* Bamboo 5.9.7 is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download.
* Bamboo 5.8.5 is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download-archives.

\\
*Acknowledgements:*
We would like to credit Matthias Kaiser of [Code White|http://www.code-white.com/] for reporting this issue to us.
 
\\
For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/Hw7RLg].
fields.summary: CVE-2015-6576: Deserialisation Resulting in Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Recently, some Cloud instances are failing to publish artifact with an error. Other bugs when publishing bugs happened with different errors.
Note: the bug is not limited to Cloud, it was spotted there because it became more frequent with the recent update.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to run a plan with an artifact

h3. Expected Results
The artifacts are published.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the Bamboo logs:
{noformat}
2015-10-06 06:54:31,790 INFO [0-BAM::Elastic Agent on i-12345678::Agent:pool-3-thread-1] [RetryExec] I/O exception (java.net.SocketTimeoutException) caught when processing request to {}->httpt://127.0.0.1:46593: Read timed out
2015-10-06 06:54:31,790 INFO [0-BAM::Elastic Agent on i-12345678::Agent:pool-3-thread-1] [RetryExec] Retrying request to {}->httpt://127.0.0.1:46593
{noformat}


h3.Workaround
*For Linux Elastic Instances only*
Add this to the Startup Script:
{noformat}
sed -i 's@.*MARKER.*@sed -i "s/-Xmx256m/-Xmx256m -Dbamboo.agent.http.client.timeout=3600/" $startupScript@' /opt/bamboo-elastic-agent/bin/bamboo-elastic-agent
{noformat}

*For remote agents*
add
{noformat}
-Dbamboo.agent.http.client.timeout=3600
{noformat}
to the agent command line.

*For Windows elastic instances*
None so far
fields.summary: Timeouts and retries when publishing artifacts

fields.description:
h6. Problem

Users may find themselves trying to understand why their Git and Mercurial builds are failing, even after setting up the Git and Mercurial capabilities on the Bamboo Server and remote agent with the default configuration. The path should *not* be auto-populated with a variable when adding a Git or Mercurial capability.

h6. Steps to reproduce

# Go to {{Bamboo administration >> Build resources >> Server capabilities}}.
#* If you're running builds using a remote agent, go to {{Bamboo administration >> Agents >> _agent name_ >> Capabilities}}
# Add a capability.
# Select *Mercurial* or *Git* in the Capability type field.
# Bamboo will auto-populate the Path field with the following:
#* For Mercurial: {{system.hg.executable}}.
#* For Git: {{system.git.executable}}.
# Save.

If the user set up a build plan to checkout code from a Git/Mercurial repository, the build will fail with an error message similar to this one:

This is happening because the Git/Mercurial capability was set to a variable that Bamboo doesn't recognize unless the user configures Bamboo and/or the remote agent to load the capabilities from the *bamboo-capabilities.properties* file.

The *bamboo-init.properties* file can be found in the following directories:
# Bamboo Server: {{<bamboo-installation-directory>/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/classes}}.
# Remote Agent: {{<bamboo-agent-home>/bin}}. 
#* (!) The file doesn't exist in this directory by default, so the user must copy it over from the Bamboo Server installation.

h6. Resolution

When configuring the Git and Mercurial capabilities in Bamboo, please make sure to add the full path to the Git/Mercurial executable (e.g. 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Git\git.exe' or '/usr/local/git/bin/git').
fields.summary: Path should not be auto-populated when adding a Git or Mercurial capability

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, users can have local attachments or in S3 in Bamboo Cloud. Users are limited to 25GB of local data and can see the total amount of attachments.

h3. Suggested Solution
To better manage artifact usage, give users an option of report in the UI for disk space usage with artifacts per plan, so the customer knows where most of their space is taken.

This would be beneficial for local and S3 artifacts.
fields.summary: Show local artifact usage per plan in Cloud

fields.description:
When several build agent are available for a job, it would be more efficient to pick the one that is know to build the job faster (based on build time history).

I just had a bad experience because there was many agents available for my build plan and sadly Bamboo picked the slowest one (which runs on a VM) !!
fields.summary: Select the fastest build agent available

fields.description:
Some customers in more complex environments would like to authenticate agents on DN in the X.509 client certificate.  This would be a very strong and secure way of authentication.  Additional authentication logic based on a http header, e.g. SSL_CLIENT_S_DN could improve security.

Done this way, either SSL termination on the bamboo server with client certificate requirement, or a client certificate check on the proxy with only adding the SSL_CLIENT_S_DN header before forwarding to the server could be possible.
fields.summary: Agent authentication using DN in certificate

fields.description:
For customers with large numbers of agents (or when the "authentication IP"  is allways the IP of the proxy)not the IP of the agent) this is can be difficult to identify a specific UUID / agent pairing. 

Currently the UUID is not available under "System properties" which makes selecting the correct UUID to revoke difficult.

An good improvement for Bamboo would be to place the agents UUID in the agent informaiotn section to make this relationship clear.
fields.summary: Display UUID of agent in the Agent Information page

Hi ,

We are encountering issues with Elastic Agent Not responding for Amazon Linux and Windows stock image. I went through most of the blogs but the issue could NOT be resolved. Help here is much appreciated. The snapshot attach is taken from Ubuntu. Still the same issue. Elastic Agent Pending
fields.summary: Elastic Agent Not responding Amazon Linux and Windows 2012R2 stock image

fields.description:
When running certain builds input parameters might be needed. The current way to override parameter values is not the easiest. I would be very useful to simplify this or to even force input of parameters.

Second related item is to make these parameterised builds scheduled with specific parameter values without having to create different plans.
This makes it possible to have 1 plan to be scheduled several times with different parameter values.
fields.summary: Simplify paramterised builds or force parameterised build

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*Operations* column disappears when the issue summary is too long in the Issues tab of the build summary page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with a long summary (i.e 100 characters) 
# Link issue to Build

h3. Expected Results
There should be a way to scroll to across the page to the end of all columns

h3. Actual Results
The *Operations* column disappears. 

h3.Workaround
Zoom out in the browser until all columns are visible.
fields.summary: Column Disappears in Issues Tabs

fields.description: It would be great if Bamboo could pull the MD5/SHA1 hash for stored artifacts so those could be easily compared for file checksum integrity. These could be displayed along with the artifact data in the UI and have added permissions for viewing.
fields.summary: Allow Bamboo to pull/display artifact hashes

fields.description:
Most bamboo plan configuration accepts variable definitions, like ${bamboo.some.value} to be replaced at runtime with "the-value"

This field does not.  See screenshot.

This prevents full parameterization of plans that are very similar in setup.  Since our project structure and tooling is 100% similar between our repos, we would have liked to be able to create a template plan, with a plan variable, and just clone that for each repo's CI needs.

This may be a bug or a feature request, depending how you perceive the problem  :)
fields.summary: Repository Advanced Option "Include/exclude file patterns" does not support variable replacement
Getting "APPARENT DEADLOCK creating emergency threads for unassigned pending tasks" on Bamboo 5.7.2

fields.description: Further to BAM-13643, viewing the deployment dashboard is particularly slow for non-admin users due to many permission checks being made.  The difference _may_ be even more pronounced once BAM-13643 is fixed, although it will certainly be much faster then before the fix.
fields.summary: View All Deployments is slow for non-admins

fields.description:
As described in [Naming Files, Paths, and Namespaces|https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa365247%28v=vs.85%29.aspx#win32_file_namespaces], some Windows filenames are reserved or invalid, e.g.:
- "NUL" = reserved word
- "foo." = invalid, ends with a period, no file extension

When Bamboo runs the "Cleaning build directory" step, it will fail to delete these files, and the build will be aborted.

As described in [Naming Files, Paths, and Namespaces - Win32 File Namespaces|https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa365247%28v=vs.85%29.aspx#win32_file_namespaces], it is possible to delete these files by prefixing their path with \\?\
fields.summary: Improve "Cleaning build directory" so it is able to delete files with reserved/invalid Windows filenames

fields.description: BambooAclUpdateHelper.modifyAclAces is not atomic.  This means if an operation is interrupted or fails for any reason while the user is performing a bulk permission update, some ACL entries can be lost and Bamboo can be left in an inaccessible state.
fields.summary: BambooAclUpdateHelper.modifyAclAces is not atomic

fields.description:
An update that was pushed out a week ago has broken our Bamboo build and deploy process.  It worked fine on Friday.  Attempted update on Sunday. No longer works on Monday.  We are using OnDemand.

I posted on the forums last week but no responses so far.

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/30949489/elastic-bamboo-error---failed-on-updating-stock-images

The java error is in the forum post.

We are using a custom  64bit windows server 2008 image.  Java 8 is the only Java installed.

It appears that the Deploy Artifacts are being zipped differently and our deployment packages are incomplete/unusable. I have attached screenshots of how the artifacts appear to be different.
fields.summary: failed on updating stock image
Viewing build result page results in "[JDBCExceptionReporter] Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers" (MS SQL Server)

fields.description:
Updating past a trial license when the limit is hit requires the Server ID to be input in MAC. When this license expires Bamboo redirects all attempts to a failure page and customers aren't able to login to actively grab that info. 

When the server id is pulled from the bamboo.cfg.xml and a new license is generated the customer again needs to manually edit the bamboo.cfg.xml to input their new license.

It would be great if Bamboo would redirect to this license input screen in the UI so customers would be able to make this change unassisted and without need to edit Bamboo server files.
fields.summary: Redirect users hitting license constraints to the admin page to change the licenses

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When starting an instance in Bamboo, if the user in Amazon doesn't have 'EC2FullPermission' permissions, the instance fails without any meaningful message.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since this is a common problem, add a graceful message in the instances page, saying something like:
{panel}
You're instance was unable to be started due to missing permissions in Amazon EC2. Please, ensure that your user has Full Permission
{panel}
fields.summary: Graceful message for permission problems

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bamboo terminates Elastic instances after it detects the agent is offline for a certain period of time.
h3. Suggested Solution
As an administrator I would like to configure the offline time of an agent to a higher value before Bamboo shuts down the instance because it detects the agent is offline.
Even if I have the _Automatic elastic instance management_ configured in a way to shut down the instance after a high period of idleness, if the agent is disabled (and I want it disabled for more than 30 minutes and I understand that Amazon will charge me and I don't care), I want to manually configure the time that Bamboo waits to shutdown offline agents.
fields.summary: Ability to configure the offline time of an agent

fields.description:
I would like to be able to create a filter in the main dashboard that only shows: 

* failed build plans
* currently building plans

... as these are commonly the areas of interest to build managers.
fields.summary: Ability to filter plans based on build status

fields.description:
When a build is triggered (either manually or via change to the source code) it might take as long as 30 minutes before the build is added to the real build queue. This is especially frustrating when the build length is on the same scale. As result the actual wait time of developer is doubled.

The same happens even when there is no real build queue and there are compatible agents free.

Our configuration has Bamboo + Stash (version 3.11.0)
fields.summary: Builds take a long time before they are entered into queue
Elastic agents don't work when a proxy is used
